Description: Body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery plate with a low ring foot; interior, white slipped, painted decoration consisting of lion (part of head and neck remaining) to right with added red for its mane; dots as filling ornament; exterior and under foot, brown bands.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Sanctuary of Apollo (Naukratis), Stratum AΠ145
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Fairbanks 1928 / Early Vases preceding Athenian Black Figure Ware (p. 113, no. 323.7, pl. XXXV)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 271, no. 686, pl. 91)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.2145) (phase 2)
Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 220, no. 68)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.4803 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
